How to Install debiandoc-sgml on debian

  • Home
  • debian
  • debiandoc-sgml

Today in this tutorial, I’ll show you how you can install debiandoc-sgml on debian with and without using the command line.

Introduction

Installing debiandoc-sgml on debian is very easy. And with the help of this tutorial, you will be able to easily install, update and uninstall debiandoc-sgml in just a few steps.

In this tutorial I’ll show you four methods to install debiandoc-sgml, the methods are using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic. All these methods require you to have an active and stable internet connection and sudo permission.

Install debiandoc-sgml Using apt

To install debiandoc-sgml in debian using apt, you will need to run the apt update command first to get the updated list of packages from the repositories.

Copy the command given below and paste it in the command line, then press enter. If you are using the sudo command for the first time then you might also need to enter your root password.

sudo apt update

After you have updated the package list using apt, you can now install debiandoc-sgml using the apt install command. To do that use the command given below.

sudo apt -y install debiandoc-sgml

The installation of debiandoc-sgml might take a little bit of time depending upon your internet connection and machine configuration.

Install debiandoc-sgml Using apt-get

To install debiandoc-sgml using apt-get in debian, you will need to first update the package list using the apt-get update command. Copy, paste, and enter the command given below in the command line.

sudo apt-get update

After updating the package lists, use the apt-get install command given below to install debiandoc-sgml.

sudo apt-get -y install debiandoc-sgml

Install debiandoc-sgml Using Synaptic

To install debiandoc-sgml using Synaptic you will need to first install Synaptic, you can do that by following the instructions from here. After installing synaptic follow the steps below to install debiandoc-sgml on your debian using Synaptic.

You can open synaptic by clicking on the menu icon then searching for synaptic or you can open the command line and enter the command given below –

sudo synaptic

After synaptic opens, click on the search icon and search for debiandoc-sgml. This will display the debiandoc-sgml package in the package window, now to install debiandoc-sgml, click on the checkbox that is on the left side.

Then click on Mark for Installation, this will select the debiandoc-sgml package for installation, now to install it click on the Apply button, you will get a summary window where click on the apply button again to start the download of debiandoc-sgml.

If the download and installation are successful then the checkmark option will turn green.

Install debiandoc-sgml Using aptitude

To install debiandoc-sgml on debian using aptitude, you will need to first install Aptitude in your debian. To install Aptitude follow the instructions here. Once you have aptitude installed proceed to the installation of debiandoc-sgml.

Now you will need to first update your package lists from the repositories, use the apt update command for that, after that update the package list of aptitude using the aptitude update command.

sudo apt update sudo aptitude update

After updating the package list of aptitude, install debiandoc-sgml using the command aptitude install debiandoc-sgml.

sudo aptitude -y install debiandoc-sgml

How to Upgrade debiandoc-sgml on debian

If you want to upgrade the debiandoc-sgml package on your debian to its latest version then here’s how you can do that using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic.

Upgrade debiandoc-sgml using Apt & Apt-get

To upgrade debiandoc-sgml to its latest version using apt or apt-get, you will need to open the terminal then run the sudo apt update command to update the package list, after that copy and paste the commands given below to upgrade debiandoc-sgml.

sudo apt install --only-upgrade debiandoc-sgml sudo apt-get install --only-upgrade debiandoc-sgml

Upgrade debiandoc-sgml using Aptitude

To upgrade debiandoc-sgml using aptitude you will need to again run the update command to update the package list, use command sudo aptitude update to do that. After that run the command given below to upgrade debiandoc-sgml.

sudo aptitude -y full-upgrade debiandoc-sgml

Upgrade debiandoc-sgml using Synaptic

To upgrade debiandoc-sgml using synaptic open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or by going to the menu and searching for synaptic.

In synaptic click on the reload button, this will look for updates. After that you will need to search for debiandoc-sgml, now right-click debiandoc-sgml, and click on the mark for upgrade option.

Now to upgrade debiandoc-sgml just click on the apply button, then click on the apply button again in the summary screen.

How To Uninstall debiandoc-sgml on debian

If you want to remove and uninstall debiandoc-sgml from your debian then here’s how you can do that. To remove just debiandoc-sgml, you can use the command that is given below, copy the command, paste it in the command line then press enter.

sudo apt remove debiandoc-sgml

Remove related packages, dependencies & configuration files of debiandoc-sgml

To remove all the related packages, dependencies and configuration files of debiandoc-sgml you can use the command given below.

sudo apt -y purge debiandoc-sgml

Remove debiandoc-sgml using Synaptic Package Manager

You can also uninstall debiandoc-sgml using the synaptic package manager, first open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or search and open it directly.

After that in synaptic search for debiandoc-sgml, right-click the debiandoc-sgml package and click on the Mark for Complete Removal option. Now to uninstall debiandoc-sgml click on the apply button then in summary click on apply again.

Conclusion

That is how you can install debiandoc-sgml on debian using the command line or using the synaptic package manager. I also showed you how you can uninstall and upgrade debiandoc-sgml using the command line or using the synaptic package manager.

If you need any help regarding the installation of debiandoc-sgml then send me a mail at netmikoblog@gmail.com, thank you.
